chargeHist.descr: Resist Officer - Substantial Bodily Harm/Soft Tissue Injury

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerome V Walker Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jerome V Walker in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
   Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.   COUNT 1:    Court sentenced defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction CONCURRENT with any sentence with credit for 3 days served; Huber privileges for work and treatment. 

COUNT 2:     Court sentenced defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction CONCURRENT with any sentence with credit for 3 days served; Huber privileges for work and treatment. 

COUNTS 1 AND 2: 
*Pay all costs and surcharges by 3-27-16 or a civil judgment to be entered.
*Court WAIVED the mandatory DNA surcharge as NO SAMPLE WAS ORDERED.  

Appeal rights given.

ADDRESS INFO for Jerome V Walker Jr
Current: 10311 West Fond Du Lac Avenue Apt F, Milwaukee, WI 53224-5501 United States  (Effective: 02-19-2015)
Prior: 5063 North 26th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53209

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2 as amended:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.    Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.

Defendant Jerome V Walker in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended information received and filed STRIKING the "2nd or Subsequent Offense" penalty enhancer as to Count 1 and "Substantial Bodily Harm" penalty enhancer as to Count 2.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
